headline: Adobe Stock Falls After Downgrade. The Case to Sell as AI Bites.
summary: Adobe  stock was falling in premarket trading after the struggling software giant received its first Sell rating in months.  The shares were downgraded from Neutral by Rothschild & Co Redburn analyst Omar Sheikh.  Adobe, the maker of creative and document-management solutions including Photoshop and Acrobat, has had a grip on all phases of the content-creation process among its professional users—from ideation to editing to workflow.

headline: Design-Software Maker Figma Files for IPO
summary: The company filed to list its shares on the New York Stock Exchange. The move comes after Figma’s $20 billion sale to the software company Adobe fell apart in late 2023.

raw.headline: Design-Software Maker Figma Files for IPO
